page.title: 20Whitwell Wood.
page.content: {Whitwell Wood}is a roughly rectangular area about 1.5km by 1km, managed by The{Forestry Commision.}It consists largely of mixed deciduous trees. In addition there are areas of conifer, mainly pine and larch. Beneath the canopy of the mature trees the ground in July receives little sunlight and few plants can survive. Ground Elder and Ivy often carpets the ground alone, together with a few grasses and small flowers, like the Wood Sorrel which follows the spring Bluebells. The wood is crisscrossed by unmetalled roads, to allow access for forestry vehicles, and many footpaths have been established to enable the public to enjoy the wood and make use of it as a leisure amenity following waymarked paths.{Horse riding}is allowed in the wood by special permit, all other{transport}is prohibited.
